text: Dennis G. Fentie (November 8, 1950 â€“ August 30, 2019) was a Canadian politician. He was the seventh Premier of Yukon and leader of the Yukon Party from 2002 to 2011. He worked on the MLA for Watson Lake from 1996 through 2011. When the 2002 election was over, it was made public that Fentie had been convicted and spent time in prison for heroin trafficking in 1974. He was given a full pardon for the offence in 1996. Fentie died of cancer at the age of 68 on August 30, 2019. ==References== ==Other websites== * Government of Yukon Territory - Premier's Website Category:1950 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Canadian drug traffickers Category:Cancer deaths in Canada Category:Politicians from Edmonton Category:Premiers of Yukon
title: Dennis Fentie
